body:
### Description

## Version
nvim --version
NVIM v0.9.5
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1703358377


I just updated this plugin via lazy to the newest version and received this error:
```
Failed to source `/home/user/.local/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-lspconfig/plugin/lspconfig.lua`

vim/_editor.lua:341: BufReadPost Autocommands for "*"..script nvim_exec2() called at BufReadPost Autocommands for "*":
0../home/greeny/.local/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-lspconfig/plugin/lspconfig.lua: Vim(source):E5113: Error while calling lua
 chunk: ...ocal/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-lspconfig/plugin/lspconfig.lua:76: attempt to call field 'ge' (a nil value)
stack traceback:
^I...ocal/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-lspconfig/plugin/lspconfig.lua:76: in main chunk
^I[C]: in function 'nvim_exec2'
^Ivim/_editor.lua:341: in function 'cmd'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:510: in function <...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua
/lazy/core/loader.lua:509>
^I[C]: in function 'xpcall'
^I.../.local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/util.lua:135: in function 'try'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:509: in function 'source'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:457: in function 'source_runtime'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:425: in function 'packadd'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:359: in function '_load'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:197: in function 'load'
^I...
^I.../.local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/util.lua:135: in function 'try'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:395: in function 'config'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:362: in function '_load'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:197: in function 'load'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:354: in function <...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua
/lazy/core/loader.lua:353>
^I[C]: in function 'xpcall'
^I.../.local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/util.lua:135: in function 'try'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:353: in function '_load'
^I...local/share/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/loader.lua:197: in function 'load'
^I...hare/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/core/handler/event.lua:85: in function <...hare/nvim/lazy/lazy.nvim/lua/lazy/co
re/handler/event.lua:72>

# stacktrace:
  - vim/_editor.lua:341 _in_ **cmd**
  - /neodev.nvim/lua/neodev/lsp.lua:8 _in_ **setup**
  - /neodev.nvim/lua/neodev/init.lua:26 _in_ **setup**
```
The problem lies in this file `https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/plugin/lspconfig.lua:76`:

```lua
if vim.version.ge(vim.version(), { 0, 11, 2 }) then
  local complete_client = function(arg)
    return vim
 ```

But `:lua print(vim.inspect(vim.version()))` shows this result:
```
{
  api_compatible = 0,
  api_level = 11,
  api_prerelease = false,
  major = 0,
  minor = 9,
  patch = 5,
  prerelease = false
}
```

-> No `ge` field.

A quick fix that worked for me:
```
local version = vim.version()
if (version.major > 0) or
   (version.major == 0 and version.minor > 11) or
   (version.major == 0 and version.minor == 11 and version.patch >= 2) then
```

Shall i create a merge request?

Best,
Christian

comment_data.body:
I just installed nvim version 0.11 and the issue is gone. 
On this version the output of  `:lua print(vim.inspect(vim.version()))` is:
```
{                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
  api_compatible = 0,                                                                                                                                                                                             
  api_level = 13,                                                                                                                                                                                                 
  api_prerelease = false,                                                                                                                                                                                         
  build = "gb2684d9f66",                                                                                                                                                                                          
  major = 0,                                                                                                                                                                                                      
  minor = 11,                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  patch = 3,                                                                                                                                                                                                      
  <metatable> = {                                                                                                                                                                                                 
    __eq = <function 1>,                                                                                                                                                                                          
    __index = <function 2>,                                                                                                                                                                                       
    __le = <function 3>,                                                                                                                                                                                          
    __lt = <function 4>,                                                                                                                                                                                          
    __newindex = <function 5>,                                                                                                                                                                                    
    __tostring = <function 6>                                                                                                                                                                                     
  }                                                                                                                                                                                                               
}
```
So it only affects some <0.11 versions i suppose.
... and in the README is stated that this plugins required at least 0.11.3. Ok then I close the bug :)
A patch would be welcome, since the entire point of that version check is to show a useful message on old versions :)

title: Wrong vim.version check
